intro: Hieracium emmetrophyllum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and rosette-like leaves, often growing in meadows and grasslands. It is a perennial herb that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies due to its adaptability and role in local ecosystems.
